hero.title: Code Of Ethics In Research
hero.intro: The Code of Ethics is designed to prevent malpractices and plagiarism in research conducted by faculty members and students of Shivalik College of Engineering. It guides researchers toward ethical and responsible conduct, in alignment with the college's values and mission.

preamble.title: PREAMBLE
preamble.content: Faculty members and students at Shivalik College of Engineering are committed to the pursuit of truth, honesty, and integrity. Our research efforts are driven by the institution's vision and mission, always protecting the public interest.

principles.title: Integrity and Honesty
principles.description: Researchers must act sincerely, fulfill promises, and be consistent in their actions.
guidelines: Clearly disclose research methods and procedures
Avoid fabrication and misrepresentation of any kind

principles.title: Objectivity
principles.description: Research must be free of bias in all aspects â€” design, data collection, analysis, and interpretation. Objectives should promote the well-being of society, the community, the nation, and the environment.
principles.note: To detect plagiarism, the college recommends using freely available tools such as Plagiarism Checker and Plagiarism Checker X.

misconduct.title: RESEARCH MISCONDUCT
misconduct.description: Shivalik College of Engineering takes all forms of research misconduct seriously.
includes: Unethical practices before or after publication
misconduct.note: Authors must retain all research records, including raw data, for a long period post-publication. A committee led by the Dean, Research Promotion and Monitoring, and constituted by the Director, is authorized to investigate and recommend disciplinary action in cases of suspected misconduct.

misconductTypes.title: WHAT CONSTITUTES MISCONDUCT?
misconductTypes.description: Research misconduct refers to the following:

types.name: Fabrication
types.definition: Reporting experiments that were never conducted

types.name: Falsification
types.definition: Altering or misrepresenting data to achieve desired outcomes

types.name: Plagiarism
types.definition: Presenting someone else's data or work as one's own

misconductTypes.note: Note: Honest errors or differences in judgment do not count as misconduct.
